angstd.ui.io.menureader
Interface MenuActionManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultMenuActionManager, ViewActionManager
public interface MenuActionManager

Interface MenuActionManager defines all needed methods to add and retrieve loaded actions.
Actions are defined in a formatted menu file and parsed into AbstractMenuActions, which are after creation automatically stored in the action manager.
To get access to this actions the getMethod can be used, for instance as followed:
if (manager.getAction(ShowEdgeLabelsAction.class) != null)
// do something

Author:
Andreas Held

Method Summary

          Adds an action to the manager defined within a xml formatted menu file.
 AbstractMenuAction getAction(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
          Gives access to all loaded actions.
 

Method Detail

addAction

void addAction(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
               AbstractMenuAction action)
Adds an action to the manager defined within a xml formatted menu file.

Parameters:
clazz - the url to the file, e.g. "main.ui.actions.ImportDataAction"
action - the automatically created action

getAction

AbstractMenuAction getAction(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
Gives access to all loaded actions.

Parameters:
clazz - the url to the file, e.g. "main.ui.actions.ImportDataAction"
Returns:
the instanciated AbstractMenuAction for the class
